Mr. O.T. Lang has gone to considerable trouble in determining what the correct spelling should be and has submitted the following under the heading Question:

"Democracy is based on law and order and not on any one man's opinion it will be advisable for lawabiding citizens to stay within the confines of the law. The law says Village of Engelfeld, for so as such this Village is incorporated after first age was incorporated after first business is carried on under the corporate seal of Village of Engelfeld; the Government Gazette says: Village of Engelfeld, Land Title Office has it as Village of Engelfeld; more than that, the official spelling by the Postal Authorities is Engelfeld, and so on."

1. Your full name: Oswald H. Hermle

2. Your address: Marysburg, Sask.

3. Date: March 18, 1953

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country) Lincoln, Calif.

5. What was your father's name and occupation? Thelma Hermle Factory worker in California

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year) May 1903

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.

We came directly from California to Saskatchewan.

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was in my teens", etc.)

I was 7 years of age

9. What were your reasons for coming West?

My parents came to Saskatchewan because they had learned there was 160 acres of free land and because they knew there was a settlement of Catholics of German descent.

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)

My parents learned about the opportunity in Saskatchewan through the Catholic Church. They had heard the Benedictine Fathers had been allotted by the Canadian Government a considerable tract of land which they were endeavoring to settle predominately Roman Catholic of German descent.

The said tract of land was known as St. Peter's Colony. It is at the present time being administered by the Benedictine Fathers of St. Peter's Abbey, Saskatchewan.

19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

My correspondence was always with my relatives in California. Some of them helped me out with clothes and food during the first year.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

[Name of my partner] and myself got married on [date].

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation as a place to settle?

Besides my cousin, I mentioned about [place name], another cousin also came from California. He came from [city name] and settled in [city name] in [year].

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

[Name of family member] came in [year] at [place name]. They moved to [place name] in [year].

23. Is there any particular experiences of pioneer days that stands out in your mind?

When we got to [place name], we found a [place name] storm came up. And did it over rain. The water was running in streams through the tent. Mother exclaimed, "Oh, the overflow!" When it was all over, we thought it had been almost five feet deep. When it was all over, we thought it had been almost five feet deep.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.)

When I was 14 years old, I had to help in the field. We used a team of oxen and work in the fields. My Dad used to have to go to [place name] on business.

The next day we went along to Church at [place name] which was about five miles away. For the first time, I went to church by myself. I walked there and back.

When I was 14 years old I had to work during the summer months. My Dad used to have a team of oxen and work on the field. We would go out in the morning and come back in the evening. The next day we would start again. We worked all day until nightfall.

I think my mail would run around $50 of our total purchase.

That is excluding purchasing a stock.

33. When did you come to Saskatchewan the first time? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you permanently settle? Or did you make this decision?

I can't remember when my parents came to Canada. I don't think they could have returned if they had wanted to because they had not enough money left. But they never came back.

Mother said she never knew where to go when it got cold. I can't remember if she ever went back to California.

My father always knew where to go.
35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

A few families moved away from Murray County.

They did not return. Of all those who left, some have returned.

Some have not returned.

St. Henry School District is named after Henry Thomas Pinner, settler of Dead Horse Lake. The latter name was changed to Murray County during the 20s because we needed a name for the Brick Church here and the Blessing Virgin Mary is our Patron Saint.

They did not return. Most of the people who left moved to other places.

Three also left for the great west and did not return.
